title: About
text:
Learn more about our work:

Website: https://www.tiltsmes.org/
GitHub: https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/

title: tilt
text:
This is an overview of tilt’s software and data.
Most links are public but some are restricted to the members of the domain 2degrees-investing.org, the members of the GitHub organization 2DegreesInvesting, or specific people.




This website mentions a number of GitHub repositores (repos) under our GitHub organization. I avoid direct links so that this website remains accurate if the repos move to a different organization. Search our repos at https://github.com/orgs/2DegreesInvesting/repositories.
Our GitHub organization has many repos. The most relevant ones use the prefix “tilt” (e.g. tiltIndicator) and the topic “tiltsmes”.

Search public repositories.
Search private repositories.





Towards the top, each repo has an “About” seciton with useful information and/or links:

Under the folders and files, each repo has at least a short description of its goal, and commonly and “Installation” and “Example” section:

Most repos also have a website (linked in “About”) with a function’s “Reference” and a “Changelog”:




The most relevant repositories are structured as an R package. “Every package must have a DESCRIPTION. In fact, it’s the defining feature of a package”. If a package depends on another package, then that package dependency is listed under the fields Depends, Imports, Suggests, or Remotes.
Remotes lists packages that are not on CRAN, such as all of the packages in the tilt ecosystem. For example, this is the Remotes section of the DESCRIPTION file of tiltIndicatorAfter:
Remotes: 
    2DegreesInvesting/tiltIndicator,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltToyData,
    2DegreesInvesting/tiltAddCO2,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltTransitionRisk,
    2degreesinvesting/tiltPolish
This means that the package tiltIndicatorAfter depends on five other packages: tiltIndicator, tiltToyData, tiltAddCO2, tiltTransitionRisk, and tiltPolish. And they are all hosted on the GitHub organization 2DegreesInvesting.
Learn more in the book R Packages.






The tilt app is our most public-facing technical product. It helps users learn about the tilt project, and explore and request data. It’s built with R shiny, it’s structured as an R package, and is hosted on Google Cloud Run.
The tilt app depends directly on two repos:

tiltWebTool: Public software.
tiltWebToolData: Private data used in the app.

For information about the tilt app project including links to the app see https://bit.ly/tilt-app-info. For an overview about building and hosting the app see https://bit.ly/tilt-offboarding-videos.



The app’s data is generated via multiple other repositories. Here is how the most important ones relate to each other, starting from the one closest to the app, and moving towards the deeper layers of the system’s architecture:

tiltOutput: Archive of the private data, with multiple versions and intermediate outputs.
tiltIndicatorAfter: Process indicator results so that they are closer to the user-facing outputs. This is an R package and depends on multiple other “tilt” packages. See the Remotes section` of its DESCRIPTION file to discover every dependency.
tiltIndicator: Implement the core business logic of the tilt indicators.
tiltToyData: Toy datasets.
tiltIndicatorBefore: Create input datasets for the tilt ecosystem.
tiltData: Process company and other data.
tiltEp: Get company data from the web.






https://bit.ly/tilt-app-videos
https://bit.ly/tilt-wrap-up
R Packages
Mastering Shiny
Google Cloud




This is a Quarto website. To update it you would tipically need to clone the code, change a file, preview the results, render the site, and push your changes to GitHub (video).
